dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_027: Tremble, villains! Quake, ye ghouls! For thunder roars, and heaven shakes!
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_028: There is no flight from Heaven's bolts!
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_029: You should maintain such a high standard in future battles. You are the one who sets the standard, of course, but that does not mean you can be complacent!
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_030: You have improved. Less admonition next time? That would be complacency. I rescind my earlier praise!
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_031: Phew...What you need is time to clear your mind. As one of Rhodes Island's leaders, you must not make the same mistake twice. Remember this.
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_032: Stand and fight alongside me! I know you are not so easily defeated!
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_033: My idle days must be spent on thorough study. If there are any further explosions outside my door—There won't be? Very well. I trust you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_034: Calm mind, tranquil heart—I shall not bicker with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_036: It's only a handshake, no need to be so cautious. I haven't shocked anybody in years—Ah. Static does not count.
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_038: Fresh atmosphere brought by Spring squalls, many wills make new walls—Does this call for a little more passion? Hmm, I'll clench a fist at the end. Alright, from the top. What do you mean, 'there's no need'? Since Rhodes Island invited me to participate in the New Year's performance, I shall give my full effort!
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_042: According to the schedule, you should not be resting here right now, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_043: Congratulations on the anniversary of your birth. I, Leizi of the Tianshi Bureaus, offer you this device, with absolute certitude you shall put it to good use. You need only press the button—Don't point it at yourse—... Are you alright? Wake up! I was about to say you should press it when you are in danger, at which point the lightning I stored in it would be released...
dialogue_tracker.char_1043_leizi2_CN_044: I must admit, I had many reservations about Rhodes Island due to your connection with that particular case. But now, when I join you on missions, it is not for observation's sake. To aid the weak and demand justice are not such different goals. May our collaboration continue on.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_001: Hm? Ah, this handful of soil... it can murmur. It can dance. It is my friend.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_002: Closure told me I shouldn't walk about Rhodes Island 'fully equipped'... but I'm not used to... revealing... myself. Sorry...
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_003: Thank-you letters? Ah, from the Sarkaz workers yesterday? My equipment and type of Arts are a good match for physical work. Besides, their materials and fuel are heavy. And they rely on flesh and blood power to ensure Rhodes Island sails smooth... it's incredible.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_004: That elite operator... I thought the Arts I saw in Leithanien were already really fantastical. And yet, when I saw him just brush aside the mist, I realized, as a Sarkaz, he was young, but also ancient.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_005: I often think of the fighters, the friends who have left us. Sometimes, I get lost in the idea that even now, I'm still fleeing... Doctor, have you been to Kazdel? That place... was the start of my journey, and once, I thought it would be my... end.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_006: Dr. Kal'tsit, huh...? I'm surprised, but she's very reassuring... One thing, though. Rhodes Island seems to have some involvement with another mercenary group. Could you tell me about them, Doctor? It's best I don't know? I see... then I think I can guess who we're talking about.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_007: I became a Rhodes Island Operator to see my people treated well, to see them live on, and to give my fighters' deaths... real meaning. But... since coming to Rhodes Island, I've seen clearly what I, myself, am truly fighting for. That was a first for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_008: Me... talking to a clay doll... all alone...? Y-You... you saw me? That was just a little ritual… huh? So everyone already knew? R-Really? Then I'll be more careful next time, do it late when no one's around... um, I shouldn't?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_009: From Kazdel to Leithanien, so many marks carved into suffering. The moment they had no choice but to fight, and realized they had nothing at all. How do you see me, Doctor? You trust me? Will that trust... let me live on?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_010: ...The one in the hood napping there is the Doctor. Remember that well. Our road together is sure to be a long one.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_013: They used to call me Reunion, and then the Mudrock Squad, and now... I've been promoted by my former enemy. Is this what they meant by 'life is a highway'?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_014: Hm? A nice change of pace? I never take my helmet off in battle, after all... There's a lot of reasons why, but things have changed now. K... Keep it off? If I have to…
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_017: I'm a Rhodes Island Operator, now. I'll obey your commands.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_018: I'm captain…? I don't like to lead, but… I'm used to it.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_022: Orders please. The rocks are listening.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_029: Running is pointless... Resist, even if you lost the will. This is the only way I've learned to face suffering.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_030: My friends are quietly celebrating. They're cheering for our victory, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_032: This isn't the first time I've turned and run from an enemy. If this is how we save lives... I'll cover your backs.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_038: The New Year? I see. Another year has passed. I... never liked days like this before, the whole idea of 'out with the old, in with the new.' What we lost has always left a much deeper impression than what we gained, but maybe things are slightly different now. Mm—may I join in on the dinner party? Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. This is for you. Ah, it's a stone sculpture of my making, not a 'friend'. 'Friends' can't be given away as presents. You like it? I could teach you, sometime, to talk to my friends. Are you interested?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_044: In the beginning, all I wanted was to survive. But before I knew it, I'd shouldered the responsibility for leading my people. I want to find myself, and my people, a home. Doctor, should I keep walking with Rhodes Island, will I be able to?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_001: Hm? Ah, this handful of soil... it can murmur. It can dance. It is my friend.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_002: Closure told me I shouldn't walk about Rhodes Island 'fully equipped'... but I'm not used to... revealing... myself. Sorry...
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_003: Thank-you letters? Ah, from the Sarkaz workers yesterday? My equipment and type of Arts are a good match for physical work. Besides, their materials and fuel are heavy. And they rely on flesh and blood power to ensure Rhodes Island sails smooth... it's incredible.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_004: That elite operator... I thought the Arts I saw in Leithanien were already really fantastical. And yet, when I saw him just brush aside the mist, I realized, as a Sarkaz, he was young, but also ancient.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_005: I often think of the fighters, the friends who have left us. Sometimes, I get lost in the idea that even now, I'm still fleeing... Doctor, have you been to Kazdel? That place... was the start of my journey, and once, I thought it would be my... end.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_006: Dr. Kal'tsit, huh...? I'm surprised, but she's very reassuring... One thing, though. Rhodes Island seems to have some involvement with another mercenary group. Could you tell me about them, Doctor? It's best I don't know? I see... then I think I can guess who we're talking about.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_007: I became a Rhodes Island Operator to see my people treated well, to see them live on, and to give my fighters' deaths... real meaning. But... since coming to Rhodes Island, I've seen clearly what I, myself, am truly fighting for. That was a first for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_008: Me... talking to a clay doll... all alone...? Y-You... you saw me? That was just a little ritual… huh? So everyone already knew? R-Really? Then I'll be more careful next time, do it late when no one's around... um, I shouldn't?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_009: From Kazdel to Leithanien, so many marks carved into suffering. The moment they had no choice but to fight, and realized they had nothing at all. How do you see me, Doctor? You trust me? Will that trust... let me live on?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_010: ...The one in the hood napping there is the Doctor. Remember that well. Our road together is sure to be a long one.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_013: They used to call me Reunion, and then the Mudrock Squad, and now... I've been promoted by my former enemy. Is this what they meant by 'life is a highway'?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_014: Hm? A nice change of pace? I never take my helmet off in battle, after all... There's a lot of reasons why, but things have changed now. K... Keep it off? If I have to…
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_017: I'm a Rhodes Island Operator, now. I'll obey your commands.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_018: I'm captain…? I don't like to lead, but… I'm used to it.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_022: Orders please. The rocks are listening.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_029: Running is pointless... Resist, even if you lost the will. This is the only way I've learned to face suffering.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_030: My friends are quietly celebrating. They're cheering for our victory, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_032: This isn't the first time I've turned and run from an enemy. If this is how we save lives... I'll cover your backs.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_038: The New Year? I see. Another year has passed. I... never liked days like this before, the whole idea of 'out with the old, in with the new.' What we lost has always left a much deeper impression than what we gained, but maybe things are slightly different now. Mm—may I join in on the dinner party? Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. This is for you. Ah, it's a stone sculpture of my making, not a 'friend'. 'Friends' can't be given away as presents. You like it? I could teach you, sometime, to talk to my friends. Are you interested?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_044: In the beginning, all I wanted was to survive. But before I knew it, I'd shouldered the responsibility for leading my people. I want to find myself, and my people, a home. Doctor, should I keep walking with Rhodes Island, will I be able to?
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_005: A victory nodded in by capital bears no glory. Yet it was thus I first came to meet those souls who harbored faith, and was able to light that flame. I pray that this flame can show the way forward, that it may inspire those who crawl to stand back on their feet and forge ahead, that it sheds the darkness, that it reveals the true light of hope. Doctor, I have always firmly believed so.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_026: Tremble, in the face of true bravery.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_002: The Originium crystal on my forehead is often regarded as an adornment. A very convenient mistake, saving me the effort of concealing my Infected status. However, every time pain crosses my brows, I am deeply struck by my own folly. I've always yearned to leave Sargon, yet where lies the path that truly belongs to me?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_004: I abhor the black market. It is a cesspool of petty, hollow schemes. Everyone there fancies themselves a seasoned player, yet all meet a dismal end. Sometimes, a meticulous mind is all it takes to send someone to their demise. Even... a padishah's very own appointed lord ameer. Might you be curious, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_007: 'Were I to return to Columbia'... I cannot say I've never entertained the possibility over the years, but such supposition would only serve to shake me. Doctor, I hope you will use me to the utmost. If such mild civilian technologies have become a stranger to me, I would now much rather renounce them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_038: Short-term disembarkment application. Rhodes Island stopping over here's a perfect place to hunt some sandbeast food. I'll be gone half a day. Offices are deserted—lucky I ran into you... Yeah, it is New Year's today, Happy New Year. So?
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_043: Happy birthday to you, Doctor. Made you this cake. And here's that giant sandbeast print I photoed... Why didn't you think I'd come? I'm your friend. I'd make you sad forgetting your birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_044: A 'pipe dream'... that's how I hear some people describe Rhodes Island. My destination's nothing like this ship's, night and day, to be honest. But I've gotten up close and personal with my own dream thanks to you all, and I'm sure you can make yours come true. I know it.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_001: Umm, Doctor… I'm not very good at files and reports. Do you think you can assign me to another position? I don't need to do anything. All I need to do is… be here? Doctor… You're a bit strange.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_002: Everyone at Rhodes Island is my friend. The elite operators and my squad mates are my family. Dr. Kal'tsit… she doesn't want me to treat them as family. I didn't get it at first, but now I do. They're like flowers in a vase. They'll wither and leave when you're not paying attention. But they're all I have.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_003: What am I reading? Oh, it's an entry from two days ago. Closure spilled her coffee that morning and stained a couple of scrolls in the library. So she got cursed. It was like, for every five sentences she says, she ends up spitting on someone's face. Scary, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_004: Painful things, sad things, and scary things… they slip away when I am unaware. But I can't forget them, I need to remember, because those emotions are still there inside me. I don't want to cry without knowing why. If memories are a burden, then I have to carry my own.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_005: I can't use a shield, or a bow, or shoot light beams from guns. I also can't turn those iron rods into weapons without effort. More importantly, the other elite operators have this intense warmth that I don't. It's what drives them to give their all to fight for others, and for what's right. I want to be like them. I will do my best.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_006: Dr. Kal'tsit has lost many of her family, right? I see it in her eyes. How does she live with the pain? Just the thought of everyone disappearing one by one… makes my heart ache so much. Like it's going to explode. Because she's a grown-up? Then I want to grow up, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_007: Doctor, could you tell me what this word means? I asked Blaze and she started giggling, and Amiya kept hitting her. Oh, it means kissing? That I understand. Doctor, bend down a little, okay? Can I kiss you on the cheek? Thanks for always taking care of us. Meow.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_008: I'll never forget the ones who created me and other monsters, who wanted to use us to do bad things. I'll punish those… criminals, until everyone on this land stops hurting each other. If I make them hurt just as much as we did, maybe they'll never forget.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_009: Oh… You're… the Doctor, right? I went over the records on the terminal just yesterday… Mmm, yes, you are the Doctor. Feel free to give me orders and take me on missions. Make sure to use my powers well.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_010: Hmm… Doctor, you must have a lot on your mind, you won't stay still even in your sleep… Doctor, if I give you a hug, will you feel a little better? Shh… relax and sleep well. I know how it feels… the pains come back in your dream, I understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. I am Elite Operator Rosmontis. Dr. Kal'tsit has given her permission. You can give me and my squad orders now. Use my power where it matters. Oh, right… I forget things easily. Please remind me of anything important.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_012: Yeah… I got that down now. I can use this in battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_013: I once asked Dr. Kal'tsit why she made me an elite operator. Lots of people talk behind my back. They say I'm not right for the job. Dr. Kal'tsit told me that by becoming an elite operator, I'll remember more, and I'll become a better person. Mm, I'm doing my best.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_014: It's so much easier for people on this land to give in and be bad, than fight to be good. Doctor, we mustn't turn into bad people. Something tells me if you do, you'll be really, really bad. I won't let you become that person.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_017: Time for a mission? Mm, roger. I will protect all of Rhodes Island's operators. I promise.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_018: Need me to lead? Mm, I'll do my best. It's okay that they're not from my squad, I'll use their support well and keep everyone safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_020: I don't want to see my family get hurt. I will destroy everything that might hurt my family.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_022: Give me your orders. I will get them done right.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_024: Keep your distance. And look away, you might not like what happens next.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_025: Cry out if it hurts. It will feel better.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_026: Surrender now, you won't get hurt.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_027: You won't die… I will be careful not to kill you.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_028: There are things that must be done… and things only I can do.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_029: If there comes a day when no one has any need for Arts… Umm… What will that day be like? I can't imagine.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_030: You have done very well, Doctor. Thank you. Ah… this time, can I pat you on the head?
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_031: I will take care of the rest. I won't be long.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_032: No… I won't retreat. I can't let the others down. I still have my sword… Even without my sword, I can still fight! I won't leave!
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_033: Um, please don't lock me in a small room. They're scary… I… I don't really like those kinds of rooms.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_036: Um… I-I'll try to hold back my powers… so I don't break your hand…
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_038: I don't remember how I used to spend New Year's very well. I think I had brothers, and we would set off fireworks in the yard, but I also wonder… Were they real? The people on Rhodes Island… are the only ones I have left. Please don't leave me. Not ever.
dialogue_tracker.char_391_rosmon_CN_043: Doctor, I remember your birthday now. It's always been on my terminal. This is a really, really good day, right? I don't know why we celebrate the days we were born… But just hearing the word makes me feel life and warmth. Doctor, do you want to blow out the candles? Candles are warm, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_001: I am come! Doctor, so long as I am here, thou mayst be at ease in thy work!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_002: I grew up in a monastery in Higashi. Though I could recite the scriptures by heart, I never could understand their true meanings. The great masters, among whom my old head priest, offered explanations I could comprehend even less. Doctor, you seem learned, mayst thou be able to teach me?
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_003: Rhodes Island truly lacks none for novel machinery… Hm? Doctor, underestimate me not. I may begin clueless, but I flow on with the times and learn what I know not. Even now, my music player plays the songs of the good Miss Sora.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_004: To avoid Catastrophe, Head Priest led us on a long journey over mountains and valleys. He said that Catastrophes are the wrath of the devas. I am somewhat curious, as I have yet to witness them with my own eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_005: I am not a true monk, merely raised by the monastery. At my departure, Saga was the name that Head Priest gave to me. It means high mountains and rugged roads. Only when I left the monastery, did I realize that the world was no straightforward thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_006: I fear neither hardships nor trials, but there is one thing I do not understand. Head Priest says that all lives are equal. If so, then why must the Infected suffer like no other?
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_007: Hoho. I may have accidentally joined the line for Rhodes Island recruitment, but the food and beds here are exceptional! And even a monk like me finds the pay appealing! This truly is a wonderful place.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_008: When I left the monastery, I had imagined no difficulty in entering society. It would merely have me set some rogues right, rid it of a few villains. Yet I found the ways of these lands are so unpredictable and complex. At times, I do not even know why I wield my naginata. Doctor… I am lost.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_009: I still have many unanswered questions, but I now know that some answers and revelations can only be discovered by myself. Until everything becomes clear, please allow me to continue my training by your side!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_010: Doctor… your skill of sleeping while sitting is most impressive. In that case, I shall meditate for a while.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_011: You are the Doctor? Hi… No, I mean it is an honor to be in your presence. My name is Saga, a wandering monk from Higashi. Should there be any place thou mayst need me, refrain not in sending me!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_012: Hoho, to think such strategy does exist in the world. My horizons have broadened.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_013: A raise? Splendid! My mouth has long been watering for the deluxe set at the cafeteria. Yet my pocket has been embarrassingly dry… Today, I am finally able to feast!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_014: Dear Head Priest. My mind still rages with confusion. The ways of this land remain obscured, and its troubles unsevered. Fortunately, I have come under the guidance of another great mentor. With all that I learn, one day I shall slash a way out of the troubles, and bring the dawn to all who suffer!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_018: I am to be the captain? Very well!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_021: Pickled daikon radish… Hah! I am right here!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_029: Twas truly an arduous trial. I have gained much from it.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_031: Head Priest said that one must have a merciful heart. I believe we may relent.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_032: Doctor, go quickly! I shall take up the rear!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_038: Ah, Doctor. Happy New Year. I am writing a letter. My travels have kept me away from the monastery for some years, and I have grown used to my current life. Yet at days like this, I can't help but miss Head Priest and the other disciples. Perhaps it is time for a visit.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_043: Today is the day of your birth. One's birth has two meanings: to be delivered into this realm, and to transcend from it. Head priest once told me to transcend from this realm is to realize sunyata, that all things are empty. However, I believe it calls for seeking not a realm bare and void, but a self at ease and free.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_044: Head Priest once said, 'For that which must be done, act despite the impossibility.' I used to think it was a simple statement. After all, there were no tasks that could not be done, only those that should and should not be done. But as my travels continued, I realized it was a profound truth, worthy of acting upon for my entire life.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_024: 'War'... A word I've not heard in a long, long time.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_038: 'The third nine days after Winter Slostice, all lakes and rivers frozen to ice. The fourth nine days, we can still walk on them.' Soon those ice surfaces will be thick enough to carry us, and the coldest time of year will arrive. Did Nian's hotpot warm you up? If not, you could ask Ling for some of her drink. Come on, let's go out and see if it's snowing. An auspicious snowfall tells of a bountiful year, and perhaps the new year will bring us a good harvest.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. You want me to tell your fortune for the year? Hmm, I see a prosperous one in store for you. Your effort will surely bring you gain, and all your wishes will come true. Truths or lies? Like I've told you before, the answer's in your hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_044: Hehe, what a crowd! It calls to mind some sights in Dahuang. I would take you to enjoy the local opera, if we get the chance. In the old days, its people numbered no more than a hundred, but today it truly is a city. I see you've gained a good number of new faces too. For tens, hundreds, and thousands of years, the ancestors led our way, and newcomers joined our path. And you see, we are never alone.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: Doctor, all life requires both sunlight and water to grow. While this potted plant seems to have its needs met, I don't think you've had your ten cups of water yet today.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: Who am 'I'? The answer lies only in all that I've seen. The same way seeds are inanimate, and yet they germinate after you put them in the ground. I too lodged myself in a seed once, to feel the growth of life. You wonder what it's like? Hehe, take a deep breath and you've more or less felt it.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: I am no fin, and yet I can reason what one is thinking. You may say I've spent the whole day idling. But you are not me, so how can you tell I've not been swimming freely with the fins in the ever-flowing streams? Yes, I know you think this water jug is too small for fincatching, but who's to say I can't drop a line in?
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_004: My eldest brother Shuo guards the border all year round, while my eldest sister Ling sleeps her days away clutching a pot of wine. Without me worrying over the rest of us, we would've ceased to be 'siblings' long ago. Hmm? Of course it's my duty to look after them—I'm the sixth out of us twelve, making me a big sister to five.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_005: Doctor, give me your hand. I'll read your palm. Hmm... Your heaven, earth, and human lines are really impressive. Your past is dim and vague. Your journey is fraught with peril. Your future is criss-crossed with conflict... I see, Doctor. You are an 'ordinary one' who 'stirs up a storm fighting for a good end.'
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: A pity? How so? Petals fall to the ground, so the soil may be nourished, allowing new flowers to bloom the following year. Rivers flow into the sea, but the water will condense into clouds, raining the drops back onto the mountains and streams. Even if this great land is to meet a snow-white end, the cycle continues. When spring comes, there will always be buds sprouting anew.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_007: Grain Buds is teaching some children how to make string figures? Yes, it's a Yanese children's hobby. A millennium ago, my younger brother had just arrived in Dahuang, where he invented this pastime to entertain the lonely children. A string in his hands could turn into countless hours of fun... Ah... it's been a thousand years.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: Doctor, there's a pond up ahead—Nian! I see you adding chili oil to Dusk's cup. The villagers tell of a huge fin—Dusk! Pouring ink into Nian's bowl is going too far. Oh, Doctor, would you like to go fincatch—Are you two still fighting?! ...Get over here, both of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: Our lives vary in their spans, and in their spans only. Just as how this landship holds so many people on its decks, a fallen leaf floating in that puddle is a sufficient vessel to sustain an ant for its entire life. Our burdens only grow as we gather more, yet you and I are naught but a single millet grain in our respective realms.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: Nian should have already told you my name—'Shu'. With my eldest brother, eldest sister, and my two younger sisters here, I feel as if I've returned home… Intriguing. Has that boy from the Sui Regulator not caused you any trouble yet?
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: The people of Dahuang pray for a year of peace and harvest with this jade cong. The ceremonial artifact also serves as the source of the one I hold in my hand. Summon wind and rain? Hehe, of course I can. Want me to demonstrate?
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: The fertile fields stretch to the horizon, the fragrance of rice spreads from the golden ocean... Day after day, year after year, with constant work, it finally draws near.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_017: A day of fine sun and gentle breeze. I hope everyone makes it home safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_019: Reap not what's sown by malice.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_021: I wasn't supposed to act, but…
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_022: If you're really incapable of settling this, then let me handle it.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_023: Spring breeze, timely rain; now we sow the grain.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_026: Sow the mountains when summer leaves a white dew. Seed the plains when equinox paints russet hue.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: Seeds are now in the field—another season full of hope.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: Good, good. I had no idea you were so clever and learned. I was going to ask you help me make maiyatang, but with such a good head on your shoulders, I'm feeling a little bad now.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: Perfection is a tall order, just as our crops may suffer from inclement weather, Catastrophe, and pestilence. These problems may not be solved in ten thousand years. You tried your best, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_034: You want me to plant you in the soil too, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Hm? You want to come fincatching with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: 'The third nine days after Winter Slostice, all lakes and rivers frozen to ice. The fourth nine days, we can still walk on them.' Soon those ice surfaces will be thick enough to carry us, and the coldest time of year will arrive. Did Nian's hotpot warm you up? If not, you could ask Ling for some of her drink. Come on, let's go out and see if it's snowing. An auspicious snowfall tells of a bountiful year, and perhaps the new year will bring us a good harvest.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_042: Doctor, come over here for a bit. Let's see... Hmm, the crops cultivated in Jiangqi this year are indeed taller than a man.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. You want me to tell your fortune for the year? Hmm, I see a prosperous one in store for you. Your effort will surely bring you gain, and all your wishes will come true. Truths or lies? Like I've told you before, the answer's in your hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_2025_shu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: Hehe, what a crowd! It calls to mind some sights in Dahuang. I would take you to enjoy the local opera, if we get the chance. In the old days, its people numbered no more than a hundred, but today it truly is a city. I see you've gained a good number of new faces too. For tens, hundreds, and thousands of years, the ancestors led our way, and newcomers joined our path. And you see, we are never alone.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_038: Doctor, I imagine Ifrit sent you, didn't she? She tries everything she can to get me to put down my work. She's always making trouble for me—she even threatened to burn my lab reports. You're the third one she's sent... Alright, we'll break here for today. Let's go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Here's your cake, your card, a small gift, and... I seem very practiced? Yes, indeed. I've definitely grown somewhat used to celebrating birthdays. Days like this lift your spirits, don't they?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_009: Is this the last document you have? Alright! You really kept me waiting this time, but finally, time for supper! I know this new place that's not so bad. It's on me tonigh—Oh, You don't want me spending money? Umm... alright, then it's on you. I know some other places.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_013: Exceptional talents earn exceptional rewards. That's just how things should be.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_030: Don't get cocky. This is barely a pass mark by L.G.D. standards, but if you manage to keep this up, I guess I could still commend you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Over the last two years, I've come to realize more and more that only shallow friendships need all that shallow pretense to maintain, so I didn't get you anything this year. Doctor, take the day off. If there's anything you want or anywhere you want to go, I'll keep you company.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_044: The relationships you build on the battlefield are not something you can fake. Hoshiguma seems pretty concerned about your relationship with the L.G.D., but I know why she's beating around the bush. Hehe, next time, I'll drag her to Rhodes Island to join the parties.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: Exceptional talents earn exceptional rewards. That's just how things should be.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: That's all the men and wares accounted for. Let's call it a day here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: Don't get cocky. This is barely a pass mark by L.G.D. standards, but if you manage to keep this up, I guess I could still commend you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Over the last two years, I've come to realize more and more that only shallow friendships need all that shallow pretense to maintain, so I didn't get you anything this year. Doctor, take the day off. If there's anything you want or anywhere you want to go, I'll keep you company.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: The relationships you build on the battlefield are not something you can fake. Hoshiguma seems pretty concerned about your relationship with the L.G.D., but I know why she's beating around the bush. Hehe, next time, I'll drag her to Rhodes Island to join the parties.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_043: What is it echoing through your mind at this special time of year? Is it pains and joys of bygone days...? Tell me, and let me transform the blotches of your mind into reality through music... as long as you allow me, of course.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_044: The end is approaching us. If you too believe that the emotional bonds between people help resist despair… then the symphony I scored with Rhodes Island will certainly play.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_038: Every year when this day came around, my Father would celebrate the New Year with the nobles of his demesne. And even those who lived close enough would be given favors. It was my only chance to speak loudly in the room. No one paid me any attention, and I paid none to the noisy crowd outside... I was a little girl back then, but I still bear memories of those times.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_043: Come read with me, Doktor. Ever since I came here, I've rarely found myself so agitated that I couldn't read. Oh, before I forget, If you find any books that interest you, please feel free to take them when you leave. Most of them were gifts from you anyway... Happy birthday, Doktor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_044: People often say that the era we live in has no need for poetry. They claim it cannot provide leisure, and it is loathed for the pretentious elegance of certain men. But someone once proved to me the value of 'reminders.' And so, I wish to walk with you to remind this era, with a candle, and a poem.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_001: Your room is quite neat, Doctor. Not bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_002: Water is the core ingredient of life. I've talked to Miss Closure about improving Rhodes Island's water purification system. I hope that my research can be of help… If everything goes well, then I don't have to worry about the water being dirty anymore.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_005: These water cannons were originally made for industrial usage. In addition to shooting pressurized water, they can also release high-temperature steam. So please don't touch them haphazardly; they're not like Closure's little buggies.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_006: These high-level combat data materials are based upon my own summaries of the combat situation. Please read them carefully for the sake of future battles. After that, there are a few operation-related experiments I'd like to improve, and your help would be very valuable. I trust that you won't turn me down, will you, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_007: I occasionally go to Perfumer's Convalescence Garden to relax. The aroma there can wash all your stress away, truly a wonderful place for relieving the fatigue from research. Doctor, how about we head there together and give it a try next time?
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_009: Thanks to your care and support, I've recently become more accustomed to having you around, Doctor. And apart from Glaucus and some other research colleagues, I can't say that about many people.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_011: Hello, I'm Weedy from Rhodes Island's Engineering Department. I heard your name a long time ago, so I hope we'll have a productive relationship from now on. Ah, if you want to shake hands, please take my gloved right hand.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_029: As long as we employ the proper tactics, everything's a piece of cake.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_031: I will adjust the parameters of this device once we head back. This won't happen again.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_038: Doctor, stand still and don't move a muscle, let me inspect you. Hmm… no dust on the bottom of your clothes, and your shoes are clean. That's good. Oh, wait! Your shirt collar is so wrinkled. You are not going to attend the party like that, right? Go back and sort that out, I'll wait here for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_043: Doctor, have you seen Leaf? His signal suddenly dropped, and my terminal indicates he's somewhere around your office… You thought he was a present and tucked him away!? The present wasn't him, it was the box on his back! Also! How were you so sure I'd give you a present!?
